name: Cabbage Curry
history: Cabbage Curry is a common dish in Indian cuisine, particularly in the vegetarian diet. It is a simple, healthy, and flavorful dish that showcases the versatility of cabbage, a widely used vegetable in Indian cooking.
description: Cabbage Curry is a delicious Indian dish made with finely chopped cabbage cooked with spices like turmeric, mustard seeds, and curry leaves. It is often enjoyed with roti or rice and is known for its mild yet savory flavor.

instructions.title: SautÃ© Mustard Seeds and Urad Dal
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add mustard seeds and urad dal. Once the mustard seeds start to splutter, add curry leaves and green chilies.

instructions.title: Cook Onions and Cabbage
instructions.description: Add onions and cook until they turn translucent. Add finely chopped cabbage, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well.

instructions.title: Simmer the Curry
instructions.description: Add a little water, cover the pan, and let it simmer until the cabbage is cooked and tender.

instructions.title: Finish with Coconut
instructions.description: Add grated coconut and mix well. Cook for a few more minutes.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with roti, naan, or rice.

tips: Ensure the cabbage is not overcooked to maintain its texture.
Adjust the number of green chilies based on your spice preference.
variations: Add carrots or peas for extra nutrition and color.
For a non-vegetarian twist, add shrimp or chicken.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian serving bowl.
Pair with a cooling cucumber raita or plain yogurt.
